ARTICLE_TITLE: Dropbox for Receipts: What It Means and Why It Matters
ARTICLE_CONTENT:
You know what Dropbox did for files.

Before Dropbox, your documents lived on one computer. If that computer died, so did your files. Sharing meant email attachments. Collaboration meant "final_v2_FINAL_revised.doc."

Dropbox fixed that. Put a file in the folder, it's everywhere. Accessible from any device. Backed up forever. Shareable with a link.

Simple idea. Changed everything.

Receipts Have the Same Problem

Right now, your receipts live in chaos.

Paper ones are in a drawer, a shoebox, your wallet, your car's center console. Digital ones are scattered across your email, your camera roll, maybe a folder you created once and forgot about.

When you need one—for taxes, for a warranty claim, for reimbursement—you dig. Sometimes you find it. Sometimes you don't.

And the paper ones? They're fading. Thermal paper receipts literally disappear over time. That shoebox isn't an archive. It's a graveyard.

What "Dropbox for Receipts" Actually Means

TextExpense is Dropbox for receipts.

Send us a receipt—photo it, text it via WhatsApp—and it's captured. Extracted. Organized. Stored permanently in the cloud.

Need it later? Search by date, vendor, or amount. Download it. Print it. Share it.

Every receipt in one place. Accessible from anywhere. Backed up forever.

That's it. That's the whole idea.

Why WhatsApp?

Dropbox worked because it used something you already had: a folder on your computer.

TextExpense works because it uses something you already have: WhatsApp.

No new app to download. No account to create. No interface to learn.

You already know how to text a photo. That's the entire skill required.

Three billion people use WhatsApp. If you're one of them, you already know how to use TextExpense.

What You Get Back

Text us a receipt. Within 30 seconds, we extract the data—date, vendor, amount, category—and store the original image.

Whenever you need a report, request it. You get a clean Excel spreadsheet with every receipt organized, plus clickable links to the original images.

Hand it to your accountant. Attach it to your reimbursement request. Keep it for your records.

Receipt in. Excel out. Done.

The Math

Dropbox costs $12/month for personal use.

TextExpense starts at $2.99/month.

For less than a coffee, every receipt you send us is organized forever. No more digging through drawers. No more scrolling through your camera roll. No more "I know I have it somewhere."

Peace of mind, permanently.

Try it free.

First 3 receipts on us. No credit card. Just text a receipt and see what comes back.

Start Free →
